definition: an inference (see inference sense 1) that does not follow from the premises (see premise entry 1 sense 1), a fallacy resulting from a simple conversion of a universal affirmative (see affirmative entry 1 sense 3) proposition or from the transposition of a condition and its consequent (see consequent entry 1 sense 1)
a statement (such as a response) that does not follow logically from or is not clearly related to anything previously said
examples: We were talking about the new restaurant when she threw in some non sequitur about her dog.
